Emphasis it put on measurements of the proton structure at low x, photon structure, diffraction and exclusive processes such as vector-meson production and their interpretation in approaches to QCD dynamics like BFKL or CCFM.

entry.summary: A brief survey of the results on diboson production at the Tevatron is presented. Measured cross sections for $W\gamma$, $Z\gamma$, $WW$, and limits on WZ/ZZ are summarized.
entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at the XLth Recontres de Moriond QCD (2005)

entry.title: Study of J/psi decays to Lambda Lambdabar and Sigma0 Sigma0bar
entry.summary: The branching ratios and Angular distributions for J/psi decays to Lambda Lambdabar and Sigma0 Sigma0bar are measured using BESII 58 million J/psi.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: B Physics Prospects at LHC
entry.summary: Future Experiments at LHC will have the opportunity to pursue an extensive program on B Physics and CP violation. The expected performance are presented here.

author.name: Marta Calvi
author.arxiv:affiliation: Universita` di Milano Bicocca and INFN

entry.arxiv:comment: Presented at XXXXth Rencontres de Moriond, Electroweak Interaction and Unified Theories, March 5-12, 2005

entry.title: Structure functions and parton distribution functions at the HERA ep collider
entry.summary: Recent results on structure functions and parton distribution functions at HERA are presented. Results on the measurements of the structure functions F2, FL and F3 will be covered, as well as the results of the most recent QCD fits to determine the PDFs of the proton.

entry.title: Electroweak Measurements at CDF
entry.summary: We present some recent measurements on electroweak physics using data collected by the CDF experiment at the Tevatron proton anti-proton collider ($\sqrt{s}=1.96\mathrm{TeV}$) at Fermilab (Batavia, Ill, USA).
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages 3 figures contribution to the 2005 Lake Louise Winter Institute

entry.title: Experimental Review on Pentaquarks
entry.summary: The experimental evidence for pentaquarks is reviewed and compared with the experiments that do not see any sign of pentaquarks.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk at the Les Rencontres de Physique de la Vallee d'Aoste 17 pages, 11 figures

entry.title: Bose-Einstein correlations in e+e- annihilation and e+e- ==> W+W-
entry.summary: Results on Bose-Einstein correlations in e+e- ==> hadrons are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at Fourth Workshop on Particle Correlations and Femtoscopy, Kromeriz, Czech Republic, August 15-17, 2005. A shortened version will appear in the proceedings

entry.title: Daya Bay Neutrino Experiment
entry.summary: The Daya Bay Neutrino Experiment is proposed to measure sin^2(2\theta_{13}) to better than 0.01 at 90% C.L. in a three-year run. The experimental site, detector design, and background estimation are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, To appear in Proceedings of NuFact05

entry.title: The SPL-Fréjus physics potential
entry.summary: An optimization of the CERN-SPL beam line has been performed which leads to better sensitivities to the $\theta\_{13}$ mixing angle and to the $\delta\_{CP}$ violating phase than those advocated considering baseline scenario.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, 3 figures. To be published in Nuclear Physics B (Proceedings Supplement)

entry.title: Inclusive Hadronic Results at BaBar: ISR and Pentaquark Searches
entry.summary: We present recent measurements of hadronic cross-sections from the BaBar experiment and report preliminary results on searches for pentaquark states.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 9 postscript figues, contributed to the Proceedings of DAFNE04

entry.title: Deeply virtual Compton scattering and prompt photon production at ZEUS and H1 experiments
entry.summary: Recent results on prompt photon production and Deeply Virtual Compton Scattering (DVCS) from ZEUS and H1 experiments are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 4 figures, proceedings for Photon 2005

entry.title: Physics Potential of the gamma=100,100 Beta Beam
entry.summary: The physics potential of a Beta Beam fired from CERN to a 440 kton water Cerenkov detector at a distance of 130 Km is computed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings of Nufact05, Laboratori Nazionali di Frascati, June 21-26, 2005

entry.title: Charmonium from CLEO
entry.summary: At CLEO, the charmonium singlet states eta_c(2 1S0) and h_c(1 1P1) have been firmly identified and a long standing discrepancy for Gamma_(gamma gamma)(chi_c2) has been resolved.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 3 figures, contibuted to PANIC 2005

entry.title: Beauty and Charm Physics at HERA
entry.summary: The most recent beauty and charm results from the ZEUS and H1 collaborations are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 7 figures, proceedings of the talk given at HSQCD 2005, St Petersburg, Russia, September 2005; minor correction to equation on page 3

entry.title: Proton Structure
entry.summary: Recent inclusive neutral current and charged current DIS data from HERA are discussed in context of pQCD and parton density functions.
entry.arxiv:comment: to be published in the proceedings of HSQCD2005, 20-24th September 05, St. Petersburg, 11 pages

entry.title: W and Z (plus jets) Production and Asymmetries at 1.96 TeV
entry.summary: This paper reviews the latest results from the Tevatron on W and Z physics, and their use as probes of QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: On behalf of the DZero and CDF collaborations. Contribution to the Proceedings of the XLI Rencontres de Moriond, QCD and Hadronic Interactions. 4 pages

entry.title: Interference Effects in D Meson Decays
entry.summary: I review recent results on Dalitz plot analyses of D meson decays and an analysis that takes advantage of the quantum correlations between D meson pairs produced in the decay of the psi(3770).
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 figures

entry.title: B physics prospects at LHCb
entry.summary: The LHCb experiment at LHC is a single-arm spectrometer designed to pursue an extensive study of B physics and CP violation. In this contribution the physics which will be performed by LHCb is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Proceedings - XLIst Rencontres de Moriond, QCD and high energy hadronic interactions

entry.title: Flavor Physics and CP Violation at LHC
entry.summary: Flavor Physics at LHC will contribute significantly to the search for New Physics via precise and complementary measurements of CKM angles and the study of loop decays. Here we present the expected experimental sensitivity and physics performance of the LHC experiments that will to B-physics.

entry.title: Multijets in e+e- annihilation
entry.summary: A review of multijet rates and event-shape variables sensitive to multijet configuration with applications to measurements of alpha_s, QCD color factors and tests of power corrections is presented
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to FRIF workshop, 12-14.01.2006, Paris

entry.title: Recent results from the D0 and CDF experiments at the Tevatron
entry.summary: We give the most recent results from the D0 and CDF experiments at the Tevatron.
entry.arxiv:comment: Plenary talk at the DIS 2006 workshop, Tsukuba, Japan, representing the D0 and CDF collaborations

entry.title: Hadronic final states and QCD studies at HERA
entry.summary: Results on QCD studies from the H1 and ZEUS Collaborations at the ep collider HERA are presented and their impact on LHC physics discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages, 10 figures, Talk given at ``Physics at LHC'', 3-8 July 2006, Cracow, Poland

entry.title: Charm and Charmonium Spectroscopy
entry.summary: Recent experimental results in charm and charmonium spectroscopy are reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, contributed to the Proceedings of BEACH 2006, Lancater, England

entry.title: Standard Model Higgs Searches and Perspectives at the Tevatron
entry.summary: The status and perspectives of Standard Model Higgs searches at the Tevatron experiments CDF and D0 are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 3 figures, submitted to proceedings of Les Rencontres de Physique de la Vallee d'Aoste, Italy, 5-11 March 2006

entry.title: WW Production, Polarisation and Spin Correlations at LEP
entry.summary: Results on W-pair productions at LEP2 are reviewed and their consistency with standard electroweak expectations is summarised. Special interest is given to measurements of W polarisation, and to new studies of spin and decay-plane correlations among the W pairs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 5 figures, proceedings of ICHEP06 Moscow, Russia

entry.title: Some Searches for New Physics with the D0 Detector
entry.summary: We present recent results on Technicolor and Leptoquark searches obtained analyzing up to 0.4 fb-1 of data taken at Fermilab by the D0 experiment during the firs part of the Tevatron Run II.
entry.arxiv:comment: for the D0 collaboration. Contribution to the Proceedings of ICHEP06

entry.title: Review of Recent Measurements of the Sides of the CKM Unitarity Triangle
entry.summary: We give a review of the status of the global effort to measure the sides of the CKM Unitarity Triangle.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 10 postscript figures, presented at BEACH2006

entry.title: Beyond the Standard Model Searches at the LHC
entry.summary: This report presents recent results from studies of Beyond the Standard Model physics at the LHC. A focus is placed on heavy gauge bosons, electroweak symmetry breaking and left-right symmetry.

author.name: Stephane Willocq
author.arxiv:affiliation: for the ATLAS and CMS Collaborations

entry.arxiv:comment: Submitted to ICHEP06 proceedings

entry.title: The Construction of the BESIII Experiment
entry.summary: BESIII is a high precision, general purpose detector for the high luminosity $e^+e^-$ collider, BEPCII, running at the tau-charm energy region. Its design and current status of construction is presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 12 figures

entry.title: SELEX: Recent Progress in the Analysis of Charm-Strange and Double-Charm Baryons
entry.summary: We present recent progress in the analysis of the Omega_c^0, the Xi_cc^+ and the Xi_cc^++.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the proceedings of HQL06, Munich, October 16th-20th 2006

entry.summary: Recent results in leptonic and semileptonic D decays by BaBar, Belle, CLEO, and FOCUS are reviewed and compared with theoretical predictions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages, 11 figures, 1 table, contribution to the proceedings of HQL06, Munich, Germany, Oct 16-20, 2006

entry.summary: I review recent measurements of the branching fractions of hadronic D^0, D^+, and D_s decays and Dalitz analyses of these and other hadronic D decay modes.
entry.arxiv:comment: Contribution to the proceedings of HQL06, Munich, October 16th-20th 2006

entry.title: B->h+h'- modes at CDF
entry.summary: We review CDF results and prospects on decays of B hadrons in two charged charmless hadrons.

entry.title: Heavy Quark Spectroscopy
entry.summary: With the discovery of new states in recent years, interest in spectroscopy has revived. Recent experimental results in heavy flavour spectroscopy are reviewed, including charmonium, bottomonium, charmed mesons and baryons and bottom mesons.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at the XXVI Physics in Collisions Conference (PIC06), Buzios, Brasil, July 2006, 4 pages, LaTeX. PSN FRIPL07

entry.title: 2beta+gamma from B0->D+KsPi- decays at BaBar: a simulation study
entry.summary: We present the results of a simulation study to perform the extraction of 2beta+gamma from B0->D+KsPi- decays through a time-dependent Dalitz analysis of BaBar data.

entry.title: Search for $t\bar{t}$ resonances with the ATLAS detector
entry.summary: This paper has been withdrawn by the authors due to the violation of ATLAS experiment publication policy.

entry.title: D Hadronic Analyses at CLEO
entry.summary: The CLEO-c results on D meson production and hadronic decays obtained with currently available data sets are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 9 figures, XLII Rencontres de Moriond, La Thuile, Italy, 17-24 March 2007

entry.title: Tau tagging at Atlas and CMS
entry.summary: The tau identification and reconstruction algorithms developed for the LHC experiments Atlas and CMS are presented. Reconstruction methods suitable for use at High Level Trigger and off-line are described in detail

entry.summary: This short review reports on recent results from CDF and D0 experiments at the Tevatron collider on Bs mixing and the lifetimes of Bs and Lambdab.

entry.title: Higgs searches at Tevatron
entry.summary: SM and MSSM Higgs Searches at the proton anti-proton collider Tevatron in Run II are presented. The performance of the collider and the two experiments D0 and CDF is shown. No deviation from SM background expectation and no MSSM Higgs signal has been observed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 5 plots (in 3 figures)

entry.title: Exotic Searches at the Tevatron
entry.summary: Recent results on searches for new physics at Run II of the Tevatron are reported. The searches cover many different final states and previous hints of signals, but all analyses have at this point led to negative results.
entry.arxiv:comment: HCP 06 Proceedings for reference

entry.title: Heavy flavour production in ALICE
entry.summary: We review the most recent studies on the performance of ALICE in heavy flavour production measurements in both hadronic and semileptonic decay channels.

entry.title: The measurement of the absolute branching ratio of the K+ to pi+ pi0 (gamma) decay at KLOE
entry.summary: The preliminary result on the absolute branching ratio of the decay K+ to pi+ pi0 (gamma), obtained by the KLOE experiment operating at the DAPHNE Frascati Phi-Factory, is presented.

entry.title: Recent Results from HERA Experiments
entry.summary: Recent results from HERA are presented. The main reviewed subjects are polarized DIS cross sections, parton density determination, diffractive PDFs, multi-jet production and searches for physics beyond the Standard Model.

author.arxiv:affiliation: on behalf of the H1 and ZEUS Collaborations

entry.summary: Several determinations of the strong coupling from the H1 Collaboration are reviewed.

entry.summary: This paper contains a review of recent precision measurements of electroweak observables and resulting tests of the electroweak Standard Model.

entry.summary: The recent results of the CMD-2, SND, KLOE, and BABAR experiments on e+e- annihilation into hadrons at low energies are reviewed.

entry.summary: Recent results from CLEO-c on measurements of absolute hadronic branching fractions of D0, D+, and Ds+ mesons are presented.

entry.title: Heavy flavor baryons
entry.summary: We review the new results on the heavy flavor baryons and on the pentaquarks.

entry.summary: A minireview of the recent results from CLEO-c is presented. It includes new results in charmonium spectroscopy, charmonium-like exotics, and open-charm decays.

entry.title: The Higgs discovery potential of ATLAS

entry.title: Measurement of the Top Quark Mass in the Dilepton Channel using a Matrix Element Method and Neuroevolution Selection with 2.0 fb$^{-1}$
entry.summary: This paper has been removed from the preprint server pursuent to collaboration policy, and is available elsewhere.

entry.summary: This paper reviews the experimental status of the Heavy Quarkonium Spectroscopy and highlights the measurements that hint at the existence of a new form of quark and gluon aggregation beyond the mesons and the baryons.

entry.summary: This manuscript summarizes a series of three lectures on interactions of neutrinos . The lectures begin with a pedagogical foundation and then explore topics of interest to current and future neutrino oscillation and cross-section experiments.

entry.title: Hadronic Shower Energy Scale Uncertainty in the MINOS Experiment
entry.summary: In this paper we determine the model uncertainty in the calorimetric response of the MINOS detector to hadronic showers produced by neutrino interactions.

entry.summary: We report recent measurements of the Unitarity triangle angles phi_1 and phi_2 using large data samples collected with Belle and BaBar detectors at e+e- asymmetric-energy colliders.

entry.summary: We report recent measurements of the CKM angle phi_1/beta using large data samples collected by the Belle and BaBar experiments at the e^+ e^- asymmetric-energy colliders.

entry.summary: Prospects of the two future e^+e^- flavour factories are discussed. The detector designs and the technical challenges are described together with the motivating physics background.

entry.summary: Recent progresses of the proton structure measurements and determination of parton distribution functions by $ep$ collisions at HERA are introduced.

entry.summary: A method to search for dark matter by studying the interaction of accelerator beam particles with residual gas in dependence on gas pressure is proposed. The sensitivity of the method is estimated.

entry.summary: A review of the recent results obtained by the KLOE experiment at DAFNE concerning the physics of low mass mesons is presented.

entry.summary: A summary of the electroweak results at HERA is presented.

entry.summary: We present recent work performed in ATLAS on techniques used to reconstruct the decays of SUSY particles at the LHC. We concentrate on strategies to be applied to the first fb-1 of LHC data.

entry.summary: We report results on measurements of the strong coupling \as from event shape data at \Petra and \Lep. These include analyses of their distributions employing the recent NLLO calculations and analyses of their moments using NLO and power correction predictions.

entry.title: Prospects for standard SUSY searches at the LHC
entry.summary: We present the recent prospects and strategies of the ATLAS and CMS experiments in the search for signatures of Supersymmetry. The emphasis is placed on standard signatures with missing transverse energy and on the initial data taking periods.

entry.summary: This article describes the analyses presented at the XXVIII Physics in Collision conference about top quark cross sections performed at Tevatron.

entry.title: Electroweak Physics Measurements at the LHC
entry.summary: Although often quoted as a discovery collider, the LHC will also allow for precise measurements. In particular, in the electroweak sector, the determination of the masses of the top quark and the W boson will benefit from high statistics and new methods.

entry.summary: Recent results on diffractive dijet and vector boson production and exclusive dijet production from the Collider Detector at Fermilab (CDF) experiment are presented.

entry.summary: In this paper we briefly discuss the estimation of uncertainties in QCD backgrounds to searches for Supersymmetry under development by the ATLAS collaboration.

entry.title: LEP asymmetries and fits of the Standard Model
entry.summary: The lepton and quark asymmetries measured at LEP are presented. The results of the Standard Model fits to the electoweak data presented at this conference are given. The top mass obtained from the fit to the LEP data is $172^{+13+18}_{-14-20}$ GeV; it is $177^{+11+18}_{-11-19}$ when also the collider, $\nu$ and $A_{LR}$ data are included.

entry.title: Probing Color Coherency Using High pT W Events at the TEVATRON
entry.summary: \D0 has used W --> e nu events associated with a high pT jet to probe for the effects of extended source color dipole radiation in W-jet rapidity correlations. We have also studied the low energy flow in these events and shown an enhancement between the jet and the beam directions, indicating the effects of color coherency.
entry.arxiv:comment: AZPH-EXP/94-01

entry.title: Search for top in lepton + jets in D-Zero using a topological tag
entry.summary: We have searched for production of t-tbar pairs in p-pbar interactions at 1.8 TeV center-of-mass energy at the FNAL Tevatron collider. The search assumes standard model decay for top quark into W + b quark. We observe in e+jet and mu+jet final states a small, not statistically significant, excess above the background estimated by two different methods. The results presented are preliminary.

author.name: Serban Protopopescu
author.arxiv:affiliation: Brookhaven National Laboratory, for the D-Zero Collaboration

entry.title: Search for Supersymmetric Wino and Zino States Using the D0 Detector
entry.summary: The status of a search for the pair production of the lightest chargino and second lightest neutralino states of the minimal supersymmetric model is presented. We have searched for four tri-lepton final states: eee, eemu, emumu, and mumumu, all with missing transverse energy.

entry.title: A Study of Events with Large Total Transverse Energy Produced in Proton-Antiproton Collisions at sqrt{s} = 1.8 Tev
entry.summary: Properties of events originating from proton--antiproton interactions in which the total transverse energy of the event exceeded 400 GeV are presented. Based on a data sample of 5.45 pb-1, the topology of these hard scattering events as well as preliminary results for the cross--section versus total transverse energy are presented and discussed.

entry.title: Polarized Bhabha Scattering and a Precision Measurement of the Electron Neutral Current Couplings
entry.summary: We present the first measurement of the left-right asymmetry in Bhabha scattering with a polarized electron beam. The effective electron vector and axial vector couplings to the Z0 are extracted from a combined analysis of the polarized Bhabha scattering data and the left-right asymmetry previously published by this collaboration.
entry.arxiv:comment: PHYZZX, 17 pages, SLAC-PUB-6605

entry.title: VLPC Characterization for the Dzero Upgrade
entry.summary: We have studies the performance characteristics of approximately 4000 Visible Light Photon Counters(VLPC) over a range of operating temperatures and biases. We will describe the characterization procedure and present the measured gain, noise and the relative quantum efficiency for the devices. We will also discuss the general operation of the devices and the significant problems during the characterization.

entry.title: Test of Various Photocathodes
entry.summary: A test of various photocathodes was carried out. The tested materials were CsI, CsTe, their multi-layers and so on. The quantum efficiencies of the various materials were measured under a vacuum and/or after exposure to several kinds of gases.

entry.title: Upsilon Production at CDF
entry.summary: We report on measurements of the Upsilon(1S), Upsilon(2S) and Upsilon(3S) differential and integrated cross sections in pp(bar) collisions at sqrt(s)=1.8 TeV. The three resonances were reconstructed through the decay Upsilon-->mu(+)mu(-). The cross section measurements are compared to theoretical models of direct bottomonium production.

entry.title: Monte Carlo Studies of a Novel LiF Radiator for RICH Detectors
entry.summary: We show that a multifaceted LiF radiator produces more Cherenkov light and has better resolution per photon than a flat radiator slab when used in a ring imaging Cherenkov counter. Such a system is being considered for the CLEO III upgrade.

entry.title: hepawk, Version 1.6: A Language for Scanning High Energy Physics Events
entry.summary: This manual describes version 1.6 of the programming language hepawk, designed for convenient scanning of data structures arising in the simulation of high energy physics events. The interpreter for this language has been implemented in FORTRAN77, therefore hepawk runs on any machine with a FORTRAN77 compiler.
entry.arxiv:comment: 34 pages, LaTeX (standard version 2e)

entry.title: An Ultrahigh-Statistics Charm Experiment for the Year $\sim2000$
entry.summary: After reviewing the motivation for high-statistics charm studies, we describe a fixed-target experiment capable of reconstructing $>10^8$ charm decays. Such an experiment can test the Standard Model and probe non-Standard physics through sensitive searches for such phenomena as D0 mixing, CP violation, and FCNC decays.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages, 8 Postscript figures

entry.title: Charm and Beauty Results from CDF and D0
entry.summary: Reporting, for the CDF and D0 collaborations, results from the 1992-93 Fermilab Tevatron Collider run concerning charm and beauty quark production and beauty meson decay properties.

author.name: Paul Derwent
author.arxiv:affiliation: CDF/University of Michigan, reporting for the CDF and D0 Collaborations

entry.arxiv:comment: Uses Latex, Article 12 point, EPSF macros for inclusion of figures Conference proceedings for Les Recontres de Physique de la Vallee d'Aoste, La Thuile, Italy, March 1995, PostScript available via WWW at http://www-cdf.fnal.gov/physics/conf95/cdf3139_lathuile_heavy_quark.ps

entry.title: Measurement of the $e^+$ and $e^-$ induced charged current cross sections at HERA
entry.summary: The cross sections for the charged current processes ${e^{-}p}\rightarrow{\nu_e+hadrons}$ and, for the first time, ${e^{+}p}\rightarrow{\overline{\nu}_e+hadrons}$ are measured at HERA for transverse momenta larger than 25 GeV.
entry.arxiv:comment: 21 pages, latex, 10 figures appended as uuencoded file

entry.title: A new algorithm for automatic photopeak searches
entry.summary: A new, "quantum mechanical" algorithm is proposed for automatic photopeak location in gamma-ray spectra from semiconductor and scintillator detectors.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, LaTex, without figures. Sample program and figures (by FAX) can be sent on request

entry.title: Proton-Antiproton Collider Physics
entry.summary: Summary of the 10th Topical Workshop on Proton-Antiproton Collider Physics, Fermilab, May 9-13, 1995.
entry.arxiv:comment: Summary of the 10th Topical Workshop on Proton-Antiproton Collider Physics, Fermilab, May 9-13, 1995. Postscript file (34 pages with 82 embedded figures; 5.7 MB) available at http://www-cdf.fnal.gov/physics/conf95/cdf3225_pbarp_wkshp_summary.ps

entry.title: Tests of QCD in W and Z Production at Tevatron
entry.summary: We present measurements of the production cross sections times leptonic branching fractions and the transverse momentum distributions of $W$ and $Z$ bosons in $p\bar{p}$ collisions at $\sqrt{s}=1.8$ TeV using data collected with the D{\O}detector at the Fermilab Tevatron $p\bar{p}$ collider. A preliminary measurement of the $W$ charge asymmetry is also presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 25 pages in a uucoded PS file

entry.title: Detection of the RF Pulse Associated With Cosmic Ray Air Showers
entry.summary: A project to detect the radio-frequency pulse associated with extensive air showers of cosmic rays is described briefly. Prototype work is being performed at the CASA/MIA array in Utah, with the intention of designing equipment that can be used in conjunction with the Auger Giant Array proposal.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, latex, no figures

entry.title: Hadronic Final States in Deeply Inelastic Scattering
entry.summary: Results on hadronic final states in deeply inelastic scattering are reviewed. They comprise jet production and its interpretation in perturbative QCD, signatures to distinguish conventional QCD dynamics from possible new features of QCD at small $x$, and measurements of inclusive charged particle production. Theoretical developments such as color dipole emission and instanton induced final states are reported on.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages,latex,epsfig,qcdparis.sty, 12 figues+kuhlen.sty uuencoded

entry.title: $B_s$ Mixing via $ψK^*$
entry.summary: The decay mode $B_s\to\psi \overline{K}^*$ is suggested as a very good way to measure the $B_s$ mixing parameter $x_s$. These decays can be gathered using a $\psi\to\ell^+\ell^-$ trigger. This final state has a well resolved four track decay vertex, useful for good time resolution and background rejection.
entry.arxiv:comment: Also available at http://fnpspa.fnal.gov/public_documents/psiks.ps

entry.title: Production of Charm, Charmonium, and Beauty in 800$\,$GeV Proton-Nucleon Collisions
entry.summary: Some recent results from the Fermilab fixed-target experiment E789 on production of charm, charmonium, and beauty are summarized and compared to model predictions. The data indicate that heavy-quark and quarkonium production are not yet entirely understood. The largest discrepancy concerns the rate of $\psi^\prime$ production, which is a factor $\approx$25 above expectations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages, 2 PostScript figures

entry.title: Searching for Antiproton Decay at the Fermilab Antiproton Accumulator
entry.summary: This paper describes an experimental search for antiproton decay at the Fermilab Antiproton Accumulator. The E868 (APEX) experimental setup is described. The APEX data is expected to be sensitive to antiproton decay if the antiproton lifetimes is less than a few times 100 000 years.
entry.arxiv:comment: http://fnapx1.fnal.gov/talks/eps_preprint.ps

entry.title: Recent results from TRISTAN
entry.summary: The TRISTAN results from 1994 to 1995 are reviewed in this report. The physics results dominated the $\gamma \gamma$ physics. Therefore, only these are selected in this article. We have systematically investigated jet productions, the $\gamma$-structure function, and charm pair productions in $\gamma \gamma$ processes. The results, discussions, and future prospects are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 pages, latex, 12 figures, mpeg simulations available at http://topsun1.kek.jp/~enomoto/ssi95.ps

entry.title: CP and Rare Decays
entry.summary: $CP$ violation experiments, new measurements of the parameters of the neutral \K\ system and searches for rare decays are summarized. Perspectives for the near future are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 21 pages, 8 eps figures included. Standard TeX file, macro files included. Files are tar-compressed and uuencoded (lp95.uu). Invited Talk at the XVII International Symposium on Lepton-Photon Interactions, August 10-15, 1995, Beijing, China. To be Published in the Proceedings

entry.title: Charm Lifetimes and Semileptonic Decays
entry.summary: This paper gives an experimental overview of current status and open questions on charm lifetimes and semileptonic decays, the latter including new results presented by E687 and CLEO at this Conference.

author.name: S. Bianco
author.arxiv:affiliation: Laboratori Nazionali di Frascati - INFN, PO Box 13, I00044 Frascati, Roma, Italy

entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, no macros, no figures
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Proc. 1995 Int. Europhysics Conference on High Energy Physics, Brussels, Belgium, July 27-August 2, 1995

entry.title: Particle Physics in International Collaboration
entry.summary: Particle Physics in International Collaboration. Talk given at Kolloquiumstag ``125 Jahre Teilchenphysik in Aachen", October 1995
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages. 7 postscript figures + 1 postscript preprint logo + 1 LaTeX file + 2 style files. Uses epsf and rotating style files. Files tarred, gzipped and uuencoded into 1 file. Also available at http://ppewww.ph.gla.ac.uk/preprints/96/02/

entry.title: New Particle Searches at Tevatron (II)
entry.summary: Various recent results of new particle searches at the Fermilab Tevatron are presented. No evidence is found for supersymmetric particles (chargino, gluino), leptoquark bosons and heavy gauge bosons in p-pbar collisions at sqrt{s} = 1.8 TeV. Excluded mass regions for each particle are determined.

author.name: Teruki Kamon
author.arxiv:affiliation: Texas A&M University, On behalf of the CDF and D0 Collaborations

entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX, uses epsf.sty, 6 pages, 3 PS figures, to appear in Proceedings of XXXIst Recontres de Moriond (QCD), March, 1996

entry.title: Heavy Flavour Production at HERA
entry.summary: Recent results from the experiments ZEUS and H1 on charm production in $ep$ collisions are reviewed. The topics are elastic and inelastic $J/\psi$ photoproduction, $D^*$ photoproduction differential cross sections and a first look at the proton structure function F_2^{c\bar{c}}.
entry.arxiv:comment: 14 p, latex, 10 figs app. uuencoded file, 2 references corrected

entry.title: Searches at LEP 1.5
entry.summary: The energy upgrade at LEP allows new regimes to be explored in the search for physics beyond the Standard Model. The searches for new physics using the ALEPH, DELPHI, L3, and OPAL data are described, and the results are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: To appear in the Proceedings of the XXXI Rencontres de Moriond, Electroweak Interactions and Unified Theories, March, 1996. 8 pages, latex, 2 figures

entry.title: Search for D0 - D0_bar Mixing in Semileptonic Decay Modes
entry.summary: We report the result of a search for D0 - D0_bar mixing in the data from hadroproduction experiment E791 at Fermilab. We use the D* tag and semileptonic decay vertices of D0 to look for wrong-sign decays with mixing time dependence.
entry.arxiv:comment: Total 9 pages, Includes two figures

entry.title: Baryon production in ALEPH
entry.summary: Several recent results of the ALEPH Collaboration covering different aspects of baryon production on the Z resonance are presented. In particular production rates of hyperons, the full kinematical reconstruction of the Lambda_b, observation of Xi_b in its semileptonic decay, and the measurements of the polarization of Lambda and Lambda_b baryons are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 8 postscript figures, uses here.sty, epsfig.sty

entry.title: Properties of the a0(980) meson
entry.summary: The mass and width of the a0(980) have been independently determined from a nearly background free data sample and the coupling constants to the eta-pi and K-K-bar modes have been determined

author.name: S. Teige for the E852 collaboaration

entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pages 2 figures, for the Proceedings of DPF '96, Minneapolis

entry.title: Diffractive Interactions
entry.summary: The general framework of diffractive deep inelastic scattering is introduced and reports given in the session on diffractive interactions at the International Workshop on Deep-Inelastic Scattering and Related Phenomena, Rome, April 1996, are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: LaTeX with procl.sty, 20 pages. To appear in the Proceedings of the International Workshop on Deep Inelastic Scattering and Related Phenomena, Roma, Italy, April 1996

entry.title: Future Measurement of the Longitudinal Proton Structure Function at HERA
entry.summary: A study is presented of a possible future measurement of the longitudinal structure function $F_{L}(x,Q^{2})$ with different proton beam energies at HERA.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages Latex, including 1 ps-figure. To appear in: Proc. of the 1996 HERA Physics Workshop

entry.title: QCD and the structure of the proton
entry.summary: Measurements of structure functions and of the hadronic final state in deep inelastic scattering at HERA are presented. The results comprise the extraction of parton densities, measurements of the strong coupling, and the search for novel QCD effects in the new kinematic regime at HERA.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages, latex, master file is protvino.tex, 21 figs. as ps/eps

entry.title: Semi-inclusive spin asymmetries in polarised deep inelastic electron scattering
entry.summary: In 1995, the HERMES experiment at DESY (Hamburg, Germany) has taken its first data, using the 27.5 GeV polarised HERA positron beam impinging on a longitudinally polarised internal $^3$He target. Preliminary results from the semi-inclusive physics program are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 3 pp, 3 figures
entry.arxiv:journal_ref: Presented at 12th International Symposium on High-Energy Spin Physics (SPIN96), Amsterdam, The Netherlands, 10-14 Sep.1996

entry.title: Spin Physics with COMPASS
entry.summary: The recently proposed COMPASS experiment at CERN attempts a measurement of the gluon polarisation with a precision of delta(Delta g/g) = 0.1. The experiment uses open charm muoproduction to tag the photon-gluon fusion process.

author.name: Gerhard K. Mallot
author.arxiv:affiliation: On Behalf of the COMPASS Collaboration

entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, Latex, Talk at the 12th International Symposium on High-Energy Spin Physics

entry.title: Tests of QCD at low $x$
entry.summary: This talk reviews the latest measurements of the proton, Pomeron and photon structure functions. These measurements, especially at low $x$ and/or low $Q^2$ lead to new insight into the picture of hadronic interactions.
entry.arxiv:comment: Rapporteur talk at the XXVIII ICHEP, July 1996, Warsaw, Poland, 16 pages, 22 figures

entry.title: Review of alpha-s Measurements
entry.summary: Determinations of alpha_s are reviewed. Current results are limited to a precision of around 3-20%, largely by theoretical uncertainties. All measurements are consistent with a `world average' value of 0.118 +- 0.005 and there is no evodence of any discrepancy between `low-Q^2' and `high-Q^2' results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 28 pages including 1 figure, in PS format; to appear in proceedings of CRAD96

entry.title: Status of the Strong Coupling Constant
entry.summary: The current status of measurements of the strong coupling constant from different reactions is reviewed. Including new results presented at the 1996 ICHEP conference, a global average alpha_s(Mz) = 0.118 +- 0.003 is obtained.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages, 6 figures, Plenary talk given at the XXVIII Intern. Conf. on High Energy Physics, Warsaw, July 25-31, 1996

entry.title: Spin structure functions
entry.summary: The experimental status of the spin-dependent structure functions as obtained from the deep inelastic scattering experiments at CERN, SLAC, and DESY is reviewed. All data show a violation of the Ellis-Jaffe sum rule. The Bjorken sum rule is found to be valid and is tested to the 10 % level.
entry.arxiv:comment: 20 pages, LaTeX, Invited plenary talks given at the PIC96, Mexico City, June 1996 and SPIN96, Amsterdam, September 1996, conferences. Proceedings to be published by World Scientific

entry.title: Status of weak quark mixing
entry.summary: The experimental status of the Cabibbo-Kobayashi-Maskawa matrix is reviewed. Measurements discussed include B0_(s)-\bar{B}0_(s) mixing and several rare B and K decays with implications for |V_td| and |V_ts|. Extraction of |V_cb| and |V_ub| from studies of semileptonic B decay is also discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at the 28th International Conference on High Energy Physics, Warsaw, Poland, 25-31 July 1996, to appear in the proceedings. LaTeX, 20 pages, 20 figures (embedded), uses stwol.sty and psfig

entry.title: Search for charginos, neutralinos, and gravitinos at LEP
entry.summary: The hep-ex data base was decided not to be an appropriate place to make DELPHI notes public. Sorry for the inconvenience.
entry.arxiv:comment: the paper should not have been made public

entry.title: Precise Tests of QCD in e+e- Annihilation
entry.summary: A pedagogical review is given of precise tests of QCD in electron-positron annihilation. Emphasis is placed on measurements that have served to establish QCD as the correct theory of strong interactions, as well as measurements of the coupling parameter alpha-s. An outlook is given for future important tests at a high energy e+e- collider.
entry.arxiv:comment: 79 pages Latex, including 43 embedded figures in PS and EPS format

entry.title: B Physics at SLD
entry.summary: We review recent $B$ physics results obtained in polarized $e^+ e^-$ interactions at the SLC by the SLD experiment. The excellent 3-D vertexing capabilities of SLD are exploited to extract precise $\bu$ and $\bd$ lifetimes, as well as measurements of the time evolution of $B^0_d - \bar{B^0_d}$ mixing.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Jet Photoproduction
entry.summary: The status of HERA data on jet photoproduction is reviewed, and some suggestions and prospects for further work are given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages including 8 figures. Presented on behalf of the ZEUS and H1 collaborations at the Ringberg workshop on New Trends in HERA Physics, 25-30 May 97

entry.title: Recent Photoproduction Results From ZEUS
entry.summary: Recent results from ZEUS for inclusive jet cross sections, dijet cross sections and dijet angular distributions are compared with NLO perturbative QCD calculations. The observation of isolated high $P_T$ photons (prompt photons) is also reported.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages including 3 figures. Presented on behalf of the ZEUS collaboration at the 5th International Workshop on Deep Inelastic Scattering and QCD, DIS97. Chicago, IL. 14th-18th April 1997

entry.title: Angular Intermittency and Analytical QCD Predictions
entry.summary: We present a comparison of local multiplicity fluctuations in angular phase-space intervals with first-order QCD predictions. The data are based on 810k hadronic events at 91.2 GeV collected with the L3 detector at LEP during 1994.
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, LaTeX, 1 eps figure Presented at 32th Rencontres de Moriond, ``QCD and High Energy Hadronic Interactions'' Les Arcs, France, 1997

entry.title: Dijet Cross Sections and Rapidity Gaps between Jets in photoproduction at HERA
entry.summary: Dijet cross sections from the original 1994 ZEUS data analysis are shown compared to NLO calculations. New 1995 cross sections are shown compared to Monte Carlo predictions. The fraction of dijet events with a rapidity gap inbetween the jets is also presented for the new 1995 data.

author.name: Mark Hayes
author.arxiv:affiliation: on behalf of the ZEUS collaboration

entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 4 figures, to appear in the proceedings of Photon'97, Egmond aan Zee

entry.title: Measurement of Dijet Angular Distributions and Search for Quark Compositeness
entry.summary: We have measured the dijet angular distribution in $\sqrt{s}$=1.8 TeV $p\bar{p}$ collisions using the D0 detector. Order $\alpha^{3}_{s}$ QCD predictions are in good agreement with the data. At 95% confidence the data exclude models of quark compositeness in which the contact interaction scale is below 2 TeV.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, Latex, 3 postscript figures

entry.title: Charm Production at HERA
entry.summary: Measurements of open charm production at HERA are reviewed. The paper covers both photoproduction and Deep Inelastic Scattering measurements from the ZEUS and H1 collaborations.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 6 figures, LaTeX, uses .cls file for Elsevier Science Publications camera-ready copy

entry.title: Two Photon Physics at LEP2; including data Monte-Carlo comparison
entry.summary: A partisan review of some of the most important $\gamma\gamma$ channels accessible at LEP 2, with special stress on the measurement of the photon structure function $F_{2}^{\gamma}$ and on associated problems with Monte Carlo modelling.
entry.arxiv:comment: 7 pages including 5 figures. Invited talk given at the LEP2 Phenomenology Workshop, Oxford, U.K., 14 April 1997

entry.title: CP-violating Parameter ε_B in B_d^0-\bar{B}^0_d Mixing
entry.summary: We make an analysis of the phase-convention dependence of the CP-violating parameter \epsilon_B and give some comments on the reported CLEO and OPAL constraints on Re\epsilon_B. It is emphasized that \epsilon_B has little advantage for the study of CP violation in the B^0_d-\bar{B}^0_d system.
entry.arxiv:comment: Latex 7 pages. Previous version is substantially changed

entry.title: CP Violation in the K-System
entry.summary: CP violation in the K system is pedagogically reviewed. We discuss its manifestations in the neutral K meson systems, in rare K meson decays and in decays of charged K mesons. Results from classical experiments, and perspectives for upcoming experiments are included. We also briefly discuss the possibility of CPT tests.
entry.arxiv:comment: 36 pages, 19 figures

entry.title: Results on alpha_s and QCD from (and Above) the Z0
entry.summary: Measurements of alpha_s from e+e- annihilation experiments are reviewed and compared with measurements from other processes. Highlights are presented of recent QCD studies in e+e- annihilation at the Z0 resonance.
entry.arxiv:comment: 28 pages latex, including 13 embedded eps figures, (To appear in proc. XVII Conference on Physics in Collision, June 25-27 1997, Bristol, England.)

entry.title: Untersuchungen zur Jet-Parton-Korrelation in der tief-inelastischen Streuung
entry.summary: The jet parton correlation has been studied for different cut scenarios and various jet algorithms. These migrations are getting important for measuring the strong coupling constant alpha_s and the NLO gluon density g(xi,Q^2) from jet rates in DIS at HERA.
entry.arxiv:comment: 120 pages, master thesis, in german language

entry.title: Scintillation Counters for the D0 Muon Upgrade
entry.summary: We present the results of an upgrade to the D0 muon system. Scintillating counters have been added to the existing central D0 muon system to provide rejection for cosmic ray muons and out-of-time background, and to provide additional fast timing information for muons in an upgraded Tevatron. Performance and results from the 1994-1996 Tevatron run are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 30 pages, 25 postscript figures

entry.title: Photon Structure at LEP
entry.summary: The structure of the photon is studied in photon interactions at high energies using photons radiated by the electron and positron beams at LEP. The current status of these measurements is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 9 figures, Invited talk given at the Ringberg Workshop on New Trends in HERA Physics, Ringberg Castle, Germany, 25-30 May 1997

entry.title: A search for non-qqbar mesons in the WA102 experiment at the CERN Omega Spectrometer
entry.summary: A study of central meson production as a function of the difference in transverse momentum dPT of the exchanged particles shows that undisputed qqbar mesons are suppressed at small dPT whereas the glueball candidates are enhanced.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Latex, 7 Figures, contribution to Hadron 97

entry.title: Jet Cross Sections and Jet Shapes in Photoproduction at HERA
entry.summary: Studies on the structure of the photon are presented by means of the extraction of a leading order effective parton distribution in the photon and measurements of inclusive jet differential cross sections in photoproduction. Measurements of the internal structure of jets have been performed and are also presented as a function of the transverse energy and pseudorapidity of the jets.

author.name: Claudia Glasman
author.arxiv:affiliation: representing the H1 and ZEUS Collaborations

entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, latex, 4 figures

entry.title: Diffraction
entry.summary: This report summarizes recent results on diffraction obtained at HERA, at the Tevatron and by the fixed target experiment E665. The measurements include vector meson production, inclusive diffraction at HERA and the pomeron structure function as inferred from the HERA and the Tevatron data.
entry.arxiv:comment: 19 pages Latex with lprocl.sty, figures embedded with psfig.sty. Invited talk at the XVIII Symposium on Lepton-Photon Interactions, Hamburg, July 28th-August 1st, 1997. To appear in the proceedings

entry.title: CP Violation and Future `B-Factories'
entry.summary: This lecture contains a brief introduction to CP violation in the B system before discussing future experimental programmes and their CP reach in the B system.
entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages. 11 postscript figures + 1 postscript preprint logo + 1 LaTeX file + 1 style file. Also available at http://ppewww.ph.gla.ac.uk/preprints/97/09/ Lecture given at ` The Actual Problems of Particle Physics', Gomel, Belarus

entry.title: Updated measurement of the tau lepton lifetime
entry.summary: A new measurement of the mean lifetime of the tau lepton is presented. Three different analysis methods are applied to a sample of 90000 tau pairs, collected in 1993 and 1994 with the ALEPH detector at LEP. The average of this measurement and those previously published by ALEPH is tau_tau = 290.1 +- 1.5 +- 1.1 fs.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, Latex; to be published in Physics Letters B

entry.title: The Structure of the Photon
entry.summary: The structure of the photon is studied in high energy photon-proton interactions at HERA and photon-photon interactions at LEP. The status of these measurements is reviewed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 24 pages, 31 eps files, requires lprocl.sty, to be published in proceedings, of the XVIII International Symposium on Lepton Photon Interactions, Hamburg, Germany, July 28--August 1, 1997, typo fixed in Equation 1

entry.title: Two-Photon Physics at RHIC: Separating Signals from Backgrounds
entry.summary: This presentation will show the feasibility of studying two-photon interactions in the STAR experiment at RHIC. Signals, detection efficiencies, backgrounds, triggering and analysis techniques will be discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 1 figure, 3 tables

entry.title: The photon structure function measurements from LEP
entry.summary: The present knowledge of the structure of the photon based on measurements of photon structure functions is discussed. This review covers QED structure functions and the hadronic structure function F_2^gamma.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk given at the International Europhysics Conference on High Energy Physics, 19-26 August 1997, Jerusalem, Israel.(7 pages, 3 figures)

entry.title: Numerical Construction of Likelihood Distributions and the Propagation of Errors
entry.summary: The standard method for the propagation of errors, based on a Taylor series expansion, is approximate and frequently inadequate for realistic problems. A simple and generic technique is described in which the likelihood is constructed numerically, thereby greatly facilitating the propagation of errors.

entry.title: Remarks on Muon $g-2$ Experiments and Possible CP Violation in $π\toμ\to e$ Decay
entry.summary: The first experimental limit on CP violation in pi -> mu -> e decay is extracted from published results of the CERN g-2 experiment.
entry.arxiv:comment: 2 pages, LaTeX, submitted to Phys. Rev. D

entry.title: DEAR, FINUDA, KLOE: Kaonic Atoms, Hypernuclei and CP-Violation at the DAFNE Phi-Factory
entry.summary: Physics at DAFNE, the new Frascati e+e- machine, is reviewed, as well as the esperiments: DEAR - search for KN exotic atoms, FINUDA - spectroscopy and decays of hypernuclei, and KLOE - a multipurpose detector designed for measuring direct CP violation in the K system.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 8 figures (some colour)

entry.title: Search for CP violation and b-->sg in inclusive B decays
entry.summary: We present preliminary results on two analyses performed by the SLD Collaboration using inclusive B decays: a search for CP violation and a search for the b --> sg transition.
entry.arxiv:comment: Talk given at EPS-HEP97 conference, Jerusalem, 19-26 August 1997. LaTex2e document, 5 pages, 1 postscript figure. Anonymous ftp at ftp://ftp.slac.stanford.edu/users/daoudi/slacpub7682.ps

entry.title: Searches for heavy exotic states at the Tevatron
entry.summary: We present the results of searches for Standard Model Higgs, charged stable massive particles, dijet mass resonances, and heavy neutral gauge bosons in Tevatron ppbar collisions at sqrt s = 1.8 TeV using the CDF and D0 detectors.
entry.arxiv:comment: Published Proceedings of the International Europhysics Conference on High Energy Physics, Jerusalem, Israel, August 19-26, 1997, 4 pages. postscript: http://www-cdf.fnal.gov/physics/conf97/cdf4395_high_mass_eps_rev.ps

entry.title: Experimental Studies of Electroweak Physics
entry.summary: Some experimental new Electroweak physics results measured at the LEP/SLD and the TEVATRON are discussed. The excellent accuracy achieved by the experiments still yield no significant evidence for deviation from the Standard Model predictions, or signal to physics beyond the Standard Model. The Higgs particle still has not been discovered and a low bound is given to its mass.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 5 figures, Invited talk at "Fundemental Particles and Interactions", Vanderbilt University, Nashville, Tennessee, May 1997

entry.title: PL3: Structure Functions
entry.summary: Recent measurements of unpolarised and polarised nucleon structure functions and F_2(gamma) are reviewed. The implications for QCD and the gluon momentum distribution are discussed. The status of the understanding of the total virtual-photon proton total cross-section in the transition region between real photoproduction and deep-inelastic scattering is summarised briefly.
entry.arxiv:comment: Extended version of writeup of plenary talk at EPS HEP97 Jerusalem. LaTeX 20 pages, 13 figures. Uses psfig and prhep97.sty

entry.title: Improving Measurements of the CKM Phase $γ$ Using Charm Factory Results
entry.summary: Several authors have proposed methods to measure the phase $\gamma$ of the Cabibbo-Kobayashi-Maskawa (CKM) unitarity triangle using decays of the type $B\to DK$. We show how to remove uncertainties from these measurements and increase their sensitivity by measuring CP-conserving phases at a charm factory.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 page postscript file, postscript file also available through http://w4.lns.cornell.edu/public/CLNS

entry.title: Continuum Charged $D^{*}$ Spin Alignment at $sqrt{s}$ = 10.5 GeV
entry.summary: A measurement of the spin alignment of charged D^* mesons produced in continuum e^+ e^- \to c \bar{c} events at \sqrt{s}=10.5 GeV is presented. This study using 4.72 fb^{-1} of CLEO II data shows that there is little evidence of any D^* spin alignment.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, postscript file also available through http://w4.lns.cornell.edu/public/CLNS

entry.title: Physics Prospects at BTeV
entry.summary: BTeV is a proposed forward collider program at the Fermilab Tevatron dedicated to precision studies of CP violation, mixing and rare decays of beauty and charm hadrons. A description of the proposed detector and results of simulations of several physics channels are presented.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 9 figures, Presented at Beauty97, UCLA, October 1997

entry.title: Experiments at Large Underground Detectors
entry.summary: This talk reports a subset of the topics discussed at TAUP97. The topics are: nucleon decay, supermassive monopoles, Neutrino Astrophysics and Cosmic Ray Physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 4 figures, Presented at TAUP97, the 5th International Workshop on Topics in Astroparticle and Underground Physics, Sept. 7-11, 1997, LNGS, Assergy, Italy

entry.title: The D0 Detector at TeV33
entry.summary: The physics that can be done with 30 fb$^{-1}$ of data at the Tevatron (TeV33) will significantly advance our understanding of particle physics. In this document we consider the potential of the DO detector for running with the TeV33 Collider. In that era, the instantaneous luminosity is expected to rise by a factor of two to five. We show that the DO detector will perform well with some relatively modest modifications.
entry.arxiv:comment: 29 pages including 13 figures

entry.title: Charge Determination of High Energy Electrons and Nuclei by Synchrotron Radiation with AMS
entry.summary: We investigate the possibilities to identify the charge of TeV electrons and PeV nuclei using their synchrotron radiation in the earth's magnetic field. Characteristics of synchrotron radiation photons are evaluated and methods of detection are discussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 6 figures

entry.title: Testing QCD in Photon-Photon Interactions
entry.summary: At high energies photon-photon interactions are dominated by quantum fluctuations of the photons into fermion-antifermion pairs and into vector mesons. This is called photon structure. Electron-positron collisions at LEP are an ideal laboratory for studying photon structure and for testing QCD.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 7 figures, uses sprocl.sty, submitted to proceedings of Lake Louise Winter Institute, Canada, Feb. 15-21, 1998

entry.title: Searching New Physics in Muonium Atom
entry.summary: Quantum Electrodynamics describes electromagnetic interactions of free muons and of muon and electron in the muonium atom to very high accuracy. Contributions of other and yet unknown interactions can be investigated in precision experiments, e.g. by searching for muonium-antimuonium conversion and by measuring the muon magnetic anomaly.

author.name: K. Jungmann
author.arxiv:affiliation: Physikalisches Institut, Universitaet Heidelberg, Heidelberg, Germany

entry.title: Photon Structure in Photon Proton Interactions
entry.summary: Photoproduction of jets at HERA provides information on the partonic structure of the photon. We report on the latest dijet photoproduction results, for real photons and for photons at low virtualities, measured with the ZEUS detector.
entry.arxiv:comment: 5 pages, 8 eps figures; to appear in the proceedings of the 6th International Workshop on Deep Inelastic Scattering and QCD

entry.title: QCD at HERA
entry.summary: A review of HERA measurements of structure functions, fragmentation functions and forward jet production is presented.

author.name: N. H. Brook
author.arxiv:affiliation: on behalf of ZEUS & H1 collaborations

entry.arxiv:comment: 12 pages. 13 postscript figures + 1 postscript preprint logo + 1 LaTeX file + 1 style file. Also available at http://ppewww.ph.gla.ac.uk/preprints/98/02/ Invited talk given at SILAFAE98

entry.title: Photon Structure and gamma-gamma Physics
entry.summary: The LEP experiments are making real progress in understanding the structure of the photon, though the results do not yet give such clear demonstrations of QCD in action as the proton structure has done. Other new results are reported, including QED related effects and $\gamma \gamma \to Resonances$, from LEP and from CLEO II.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 15 figures, Contribution to "Physics in Collision", Frascati, June 18-19, 1998

entry.title: Jets as a Source of Information about Photon Structure
entry.summary: A review of recent jet measurements of the photon structure from the H1 experiment at HERA. The scale and the virtuality dependence of the effective parton distribution function of the photon is discussed.

author.name: Marek Tasevsky
author.arxiv:affiliation: Institute of Physics, Prague, Czech Republic

entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 6 figures. To appear in the Proceedings of the DIS98 Workshop, Brussels. One reference added

entry.title: Nucleon Structure Functions
entry.summary: New structure function measurements from fixed target experiments and especially HERA are reviewed. The extraction of parton distributions from these measurements is discussed with special emphasis on systematic problems. Finally the present uncertainty of our knowledge on parton distributions and on the strong coupling constant from DIS are dicussed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 26 Pages, 22 figures, Invited Talk XVIII Physics in Collision

entry.title: W Boson Physics at the Fermilab Tevatron Collider
entry.summary: This talk at the XVIII International Conference on Physics in Collision, Frascati, Italy, June 17-19, 1998, presents CDF and D0 results on W and Z Boson Production Cross Sections, the W Boson Width, Rare W Boson Decays, Trilinear Gauge Boson Couplings, and the W Boson Mass.

author.name: Ronald J. Madaras
author.arxiv:affiliation: For the CDF and D0 Collaborations

entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, with 15 figures

entry.title: Coloron Limits using the D0 Dijet Angular Distribution
entry.summary: The D0 dijet angular distribution is used to place limits on flavor--universal colorons. Models with M_c / cot{theta} < 759 GeV/c^2 are excluded at the 95% confidence level.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 2 figures, Submitted to the XXIX International Conference on High Energy Physics - ICHEP98, July 23 -- 29, 1998, Vancouver, B.C., Canada

entry.title: NOE, a Neutrino Oscillation Experiment at Gran Sasso Laboratory
entry.summary: The project of a large underground experiment (NOE) devoted to long baseline neutrino oscillation measurement is presented. The apparatus is composed by calorimetric modules interleaved with TRD modules and has been optimized to be sensitive in the region of sin2 2theta and Dm2 suggested by the atmospheric neutrino oscillation signal.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 9 figures, 2 tables, contributed paper at Neutrino Oscillation Workshop (NOW'98), September 7-9, 1998, Amsterdam

entry.title: A Summary of Recent Color Coherence Results
entry.summary: Recent experimental results on color coherence phenomena from e+e-, ep, and ppbar collisions are presented. The data are compared to analytic perturbative QCD calculations based on the modified leading logarithm approximation and the local parton hadron duality hypothesis.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, with 8 figures, presented at the XVIII International Conference on Physics in Collision, Frascati, Italy, June 17-19, 1998

entry.title: Experimental Tests of the Standard Model
entry.summary: Four lectures on experimental test of the standard model presented at the Advanced Summer Institute on Techniques and Concepts of High Energy Physics.
entry.arxiv:comment: 46 page LaTeX with 35 figures included using epsf, requires crckapb.sty. For publication in Proceedings of the NATO Advanced Study Institute on Techniques and Concepts of High Energy Physics (1998: St. Croix, V. I.) Ed. T. Ferbel

entry.title: On the use of Satellite Television in High Energy Physics
entry.summary: This paper assesses the feasibility of exploiting commercial satellite television technologies to broadcast video signals and data from major High Energy Physics facilities to collaborating institutes throughout the world.
entry.arxiv:comment: Invited talk at CHEP'98, Chicago, USA, August 31 - September 4, 1998

entry.title: Extraction of α_s and constraint on the Higgs mass from Electroweak fits at the Z resonance
entry.summary: The determination of the Z lineshape parameters at LEP1 is presented and the value of $\alsmz$ is derived from these measurements. The constraint on the Higgs mass obtained from a global fit to LEP1 and SLC data is also given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 15 pages

entry.title: Determination of the LEP center-of-mass energy from Zgamma events
entry.summary: Radiative returns to the Z resonance (Zgamma events) provide a method to determine the centre-of-mass energy of the high energy e+e- colliders and already at LEP2. The method is applied for the data collected with the ALEPH detector in 1997 at 181-184 GeV, using e+e- -> gammaZ -> hadrons events.
entry.arxiv:comment: 9 pages, 2 figures, Contribution to ICHEP'98 Vancouver

entry.title: Bounds on $ν_μ$ Oscillations from Atmospheric Neutrinos
entry.summary: A reanalysis of identified muon neutrino interactions from IMB 3 yields bounds on $\sin^{2}(2 \theta)$ and $\Delta m^{2}$. The limit $\sin^{2}(2 \theta) < 0.72$ is in conflict with the recent announcement of a neutrino mass.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 1 figure

entry.title: The forward-backward asymmetry for charm quarks at the Z
entry.summary: The data set collected with the ALEPH detector from 1991 to 1995 at LEP has been analysed to measure the charm forward-backward asymmetry at the Z. Out of a total of 4.1 million hadronic Z decays, about 36000 high momentum D*+, D+ and D0 decays were reconstructed, of which 80% originate from Z -> ccbar events...
entry.arxiv:comment: 13 pages, 5 figures

entry.title: The structure of the photon and its interactions
entry.summary: The OPAL experiment at LEP has performed a variety of measurements of photon-photon and electron-photon scattering at the electron-positron collider LEP to gain a deeper insight into the structure of the photon and its interactions. This review presents a summary of these results.
entry.arxiv:comment: 18 pages with 20 eps files. Invited talk given at the Workshop on Photon Interactions and the Photon Structure, Lund, Sweden, September 10-13, 1998 to be published in the proceedings

entry.title: Two Photon Physics at a Future Linear Collider
entry.summary: Some general considerations on a future linear collider and selected topics of two photon physics measurements which can be performed at such a collider are presented. This review discusses the total photon-photon cross section, jet cross sections, structure functions, charm production, the BFKL Pomeron, $W$ pair production, and Higgs production.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 16 figures, Invited talk at the Workshop on photon interactions and the photon structure, 10-13 September 1998, Lund, Schweden, to appear in the Proceedings

entry.title: Experimental Summary on Hadronic Decays: A TAU98 Review
entry.summary: Selected results on hadronic decays of the tau lepton from the TAU98 Workshop are reviewed. A comprehensive picture emerges for strange particle branching fractions, and exploration of resonant substructure of both strange and non-strange decays is seen to have matured substantially.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, postscript file also available through http://w4.lns.cornell.edu/public/CLNS

entry.title: New Limit on Muon and Electron Lepton Number Violation from $K^0_L \to μ^\pm e^\mp$ Decay
entry.summary: The most sensitive experiment to date to search for the muon and electron lepton number violating decay $K^0_L \to \mu^\pm e^\mp$ has detected no events consistent with this process. Based on this result, the 90% confidence level upper limit on the branching fraction is $B(K^0_L \to \mu^\pm e^\mp) < 4.7\times10^{-12}$.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 4 figures

entry.title: Measurements of A_LR and A_lepton from SLD
entry.summary: This paper presents measurements of the leptonic asymmetries in Z0 decays measured with the SLD detector. Using a data sample of approximately 500,000 Z0 bosons, we report preliminary values for A_e, A_mu and A_tau using both hadronic and leptonic decays.
entry.arxiv:comment: 8 pages, 2 figures, presented at XXIXth International Conference on High Energy Physics, 23-29 July 1998, Vancouver, Canada

entry.title: Photon Structure
entry.summary: Large pT processes at HERA, initiated by almost real and by virtual photons, provide information on the structure of the photon. We report on the latest measurements of dijets and large pT particle production with the H1 detector. This includes a leading order determination of an effective virtual photon parton density, of the gluon density of the photon, and comparisons with models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 6 pages, 9 figures, submitted to Proc. ICHEP98, Vancouver, Canada, 22-30 July 1998

entry.title: New Experimental Results on Strangeness Production
entry.summary: New experimental results on the production of $\phi$ and $f_2'(1525)$ mesons in the annihilation of stopped antiprotons are discussed. The explanation of these facts in the framework of the polarized strangeness model is considered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, Latex, fig1.eps, espcrc1.sty. Invited talk at the Low Energy Antiproton Physics Conference, Villasimius

entry.title: Stable Algorithm for Extraction of Asymmetries from the Data on Polarized Lepton-Nucleon Scattering
entry.summary: A new algorithm for extraction of asymmetries from polarized lepton-nucleon scattering data is proposed. The algorithm is stable to set-up acceptance and/or luminosity monitor acceptance variations. A statistical test for checking the data quality is proposed.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, latex + 4 eps figures

entry.title: Measurements of $B \to X_s γ$ and Study of $B \to X_s l^+ l^-$
entry.summary: The updated CLEO measurement of the electromagnetic penguin process $B \to X_s \gamma$ is presented and compared to the ALEPH result. Implications on new physics are discussed and the status of recent searches for $B \to X_s l^+ l^-$ modes is given.
entry.arxiv:comment: 10 pages, 8 figures, invited talk at 4th International Symposium on Radiative Corrections, Barcelona, Spain

entry.title: Diffractive Phenomena at HERA
entry.summary: Highlights selected from recent measurements of colour-singlet exchange processes at HERA are summarised. Particular emphasis is placed on energy and momentum transfer dependences and the decomposition of the data into an expansion in Regge trajectories. The latest results in vector meson helicity analysis, partonic descriptions of hard diffraction and diffractive dijet production are also covered.
entry.arxiv:comment: 17 pages, 8 figures, based on talk at `Hadron Structure 98' conference, Stara Lesna, Slovakia

entry.title: Heavy Flavour Physics at HERA
entry.summary: New results with increased statistics are presented for heavy flavour production at Q2<150 Gev2 and in the photoproduction limit Q2-->0. Cross sections for Dstar production, F2charm, the gluon density in the proton, and inelastic J/psi production are discussed and compared to theoretical calculations. A first measurement of the b anti-b cross section is reported.
entry.arxiv:comment: 11 pages, 11 figures, Contribution to `Workshop on Heavy Quarks at Fixed Target, October 1998

entry.title: Precision Studies at a Future Linear Collider
entry.summary: A future linear collider will complement the programme of the Large Hadron Collider, especially for precision physics. The RADCOR community has an important part to play in refining the predictions for rates and processes in Electroweak, Higgs, SUSY, top and QCD physics, for e^+ e^-, e^- e^-, $\gamma \gamma$ and $\gamma e$ collisions.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 8 figures, Invited talk at RADCOR, Barcelona, Espa\~na, 8--12 Sept 1998

entry.title: Tests of the Electroweak Symmetry Breaking Sector at the Tevatron
entry.summary: The phenomenology of the electroweak symmetry breaking sector is expected to involve resonances decaying preferentially into heavy fermions. Three recent CDF analyses are reviewed and used to constrain Higgs and Technicolor models.
entry.arxiv:comment: 16 pages, 6 figures; Lectures given at the XXVIth International Meeting on Fundamental Physics, La Toja, Spain, June 1998

entry.title: Study of the Photonuclear interaction of muons in rock with the MACRO experiment
entry.summary: We present first results about the measurement of the charged hadrons production by atmopsheric muons in the rock above MACRO. A comparison between the measure rate with the Monte Carlo expectation is presented
entry.arxiv:comment: 4 pages, 2 figures, to be published in Proc. of Xth ISVHECRI
